Class SameGame

java.lang.Object
gridgames.Game
gridgames.SameGame
All Implemented Interfaces:

public class SameGame extends Game
Class which holds the logic related to the SameGame.

The class repsonsabilities are inherited from its superclass Game.

  • Method Details

    • setGameParameters

      protected void setGameParameters()

    • generateGrid

      protected Grid generateGrid()
      Generates a new Grid for this SameGame depending on the set difficulty level.

      The level of difficulty affects the number of different values a Tile can take within the Grid of this SameGame:

      • Difficulty.EASY 2 values,
      • Difficulty.MEDIUM 3 values,
      • Difficulty.HARD 4 values,
      • The default is 3 values.
      Specified by:
      generateGrid in class Game
      Returns:
      A newly allocated Grid object.
      See Also:
      • Game.generateGrid()
      • Game.difficulty
      • Difficulty

    • checkWin

      public boolean checkWin()
      Checks if the user won the game. The user wins only if there is no tiles left.
      Specified by:
      checkWin in class Game
      Returns:
      true if the user won, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Game.checkWin()

    • checkLose

      public boolean checkLose()
      Checks if the user lost the game. The user loses if any tiles remain but no further movement is possible.
      Specified by:
      checkLose in class Game
      Returns:
      true if the user lost, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Game.checkLose()

    • computeScoreInc

      protected void computeScoreInc()
      Computes the amount of points given by the user selection.

      The number of points p is linked to the size n of a group of tiles with the same color by the following relationship:

      p = (n - 2)Â²

      Specified by:
      computeScoreInc in class Game
      See Also:
      • Game.computeScoreInc()
